paragraphs.content: Chapter 8
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 8

paragraphs.content: And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.

paragraphs.content: Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abiah: they were judges in Beer-sheba.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abiah: they were judges in Beer-sheba.

paragraphs.content: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.

paragraphs.content: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah,

paragraphs.content: And said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.

paragraphs.content: ¶ But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the Lord.

paragraphs.content: And the LORD said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not reign over them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the Lord said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not reign over them.

paragraphs.content: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, wherewith they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, wherewith they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee.

paragraphs.content: Now therefore hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest solemnly unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall reign over them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now therefore hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest solemnly unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall reign over them.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And Samuel told all the words of the LORD unto the people that asked of him a king.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And Samuel told all the words of the Lord unto the people that asked of him a king.

paragraphs.content: And he said, This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: He will take your sons, and appoint them for himself, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and some shall run before his chariots.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said, This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: He will take your sons, and appoint them for himself, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and some shall run before his chariots.

paragraphs.content: And he will appoint him captains over thousands, and captains over fifties; and will set them to ear his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and instruments of his chariots.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he will appoint him captains over thousands, and captains over fifties; and will set them to ear his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and instruments of his chariots.

paragraphs.content: And he will take your daughters to be confectionaries, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he will take your daughters to be confectionaries, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.

paragraphs.content: And he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to his servants.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to his servants.

paragraphs.content: And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants.

paragraphs.content: And he will take your menservants, and your maidservants, and your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put them to his work.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he will take your menservants, and your maidservants, and your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put them to his work.

paragraphs.content: He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his servants.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his servants.

paragraphs.content: And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king which ye shall have chosen you; and the LORD will not hear you in that day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king which ye shall have chosen you; and the Lord will not hear you in that day.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel; and they said, Nay; but we will have a king over us;
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel; and they said, Nay; but we will have a king over us;

paragraphs.content: That we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.

paragraphs.content: And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: And the LORD said to Samuel, Hearken unto their voice, and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel, Go ye every man unto his city.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the Lord said to Samuel, Hearken unto their voice, and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel, Go ye every man unto his city.
